org.efaps.db.store

Class VFSStoreResource

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.efaps.db.transaction.AbstractResource
      • org.efaps.db.store.AbstractStoreResource
        • org.efaps.db.store.VFSStoreResource
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    XAResource, Resource

    public class VFSStoreResource
extends AbstractStoreResource

    The class implements the Resource interface for Apache Jakarta Commons Virtual File System.

    All different virtual file systems could be used. The algorithm is:

    1. check if the file already exists
    The store implements the compress property setting on the type for ZIP and GZIP.

    For each file id a new VFS store resource must be created.
    Version:
    $Id$
    Author:
    The eFaps Team

      • write

        public long write(InputStream _in,
         long _size,
         String _fileName)
           throws EFapsException
        The method writes the context (from the input stream) to a temporary file (same file URL, but with extension EXTENSION_TEMP).
        Parameters:
        _in - input stream defined the content of the file
        _size - length of the content (or negative meaning that the length is not known; then the content gets the length of readable bytes from the input stream)
        _fileName - name of the file
        Returns:
        size of the created temporary file object
        Throws:
        EFapsException - on error

      • prepare

        public int prepare(Xid _xid)
        Ask the resource manager to prepare for a transaction commit of the transaction specified in xid (used for 2-phase commits).
        Parameters:
        _xid - Xid
        Returns:
        always 0

      • commit

        public void commit(Xid _xid,
          boolean _onePhase)
            throws XAException
        The method is called from the transaction manager if the complete transaction is completed.
        A file in the virtual file system is committed with the algorithms:
        1. any existing backup fill will be moved to an older backup file. The maximum number of backups can be defined by setting the property PROPERTY_NUMBER_BACKUP. Default is one. To disable the property must be set to 0.
        2. the current file is moved to the backup file (or deleted if property PROPERTY_NUMBER_BACKUP is 0)
        3. the new file is moved to the original name
        Parameters:
        _xid - global transaction identifier (not used, because each file with the file id gets a new VFS store resource instance)
        _onePhase - true if it is a one phase commitment transaction (not used)
        Throws:
        XAException - if any exception occurs (catch on Throwable)

      • rollback

        public void rollback(Xid _xid)
              throws XAException
        If the file written in the virtual file system must be rolled back, only the created temporary file (created from method write(java.io.InputStream, long, java.lang.String)) is deleted.
        Parameters:
        _xid - global transaction identifier (not used, because each file with the file id gets a new VFS store resource instance)
        Throws:
        XAException - if any exception occurs (catch on Throwable)

      • forget

        public void forget(Xid _xid)
        Tells the resource manager to forget about a heuristically completed transaction branch.
        Parameters:
        _xid - global transaction identifier (not used, because each file with the file id gets a new VFS store resource instance)
